eligibility:
Students pursuing International curriculum must note that eligibility is according to AIU stipulations:
Applicants pursuing IB curriculum must have 3 HL and 3 SL with 24 credits.
Applicants pursuing GCE / Edexcel must have a minimum of 3 A levels with a grade not less than C.
why_choose: Why choose this course? Curriculum with rigorous grounding in core subjects Connects theory and real-world applications Exposure to software tools such as Python, R, Tableau Mandatory internship and value-added courses Professional certification: CISI and Bloomberg Market Concept(BMC) Academic Leadership, Social Consciousness, and Holistic growth
what_learn: What you will learn? Interdisciplinary Courses in Economics, Mathematics and Statistics. Effective use of statistical tools and mathematical techniques. Develop critical thinking, analytical skills and quantitative skills Gain industry-focused skills to lead a successful career Solid foundation in Economics Analyze social and economic issues
career: Career prospects Data analyst/Statistician: Collect, clean, and analyze data to extract meaningful insights for businesses and organizations. Business analyst: Identify and evaluate business processes to recommend improvements and solutions. Junior data scientist: Build and deploy machine learning models to solve real-world problems. Financial analyst: Evaluate financial performance and make investment recommendations. Management consultant: Provide strategic advice and solutions to help businesses achieve their goals Research Scientist: Absorbed as research fellows at reputed universities and R&D at Corporates.
